Main.scheduleDay: Diagnosis: Mo. - Sat. / 08:00 - 14:00 Stationary: every day
Main.locationDetail: Tashkent city, Yashnabad district, Taraqqiyot street, 2-proyezd, house 12A
Main.questionOrSuggestion: If you have any questions or suggestions, please leave your details and we will contact you as soon as possible.

AboutUs.description1: In 1899, the Trans-Caspian and Central Asian roads were merged under the name of Central Asia, and a medical section was established, which had the functions of managing existing medical facilities and supervising road construction. By this time, medical institutions, paramedic-obstetric centers (PAP), paramedic centers, medical places, as well as a 10-bed hospital were established at the Bukhara station.
AboutUs.description2: At this stage, the organization of the primary link of ambulatory care was continued on newly constructed road sections, qualified ambulatory care was created, and new care modes were introduced (otolaryngology, surgery, neurological, laboratory). In Tashkent, Ashgabat, Karshi, Charjou, Krasnovodsk, Samarkand, Chernyayevo, Kizilarvat stations, first general, then special (therapy, surgery, infection, maternity) hospital departments were established. In 1918, 185 boats were laid, 1306 in 1940, 1890 in 1950, and more than 3000 boats by 1968. In 1929, polyclinics and health centers were reorganized. In polyclinics, the position of doctors of narrow specialties, who provide high-quality preventive examinations, was introduced.
AboutUs.description3: Since 1959, the states were separated, children's consulting rooms were reformed into children's polyclinics, and children's inpatient departments were established. They ensured that the children were medically examined and improved.
AboutUs.description4: By the 1970s, medical facilities had continued to improve in terms of both medical care and physician labor, having launched a major effort. In 1979-1980, all institutions, old or model new buildings (Samarkand, Urganch, Khojaly, Andijan, Karshi, Kungirot) were renovated. A hospital was built in the village of Nazarbek and a climatic hospital was built in Havotog station. A dental clinic and a dermatovenerology dispensary were created.
AboutUs.description5: By the end of the 1980s, there were 3,330 inpatient beds from 12 profiles and outpatient clinics (departments) with 6,900 visitors per shift in 19 profiles. In order to bring medical care closer to railway workers living on the line, the "Salamtlik" medical-sanitary aid train has been established, which includes two ambulatory cars with doctors' rooms, procedures, registers and diagnostic rooms, fluorograph cars, and sleeping cars for employees. On the "Salamatlik" train, all conditions have been created for medical staff to work in small stations, to conduct medical examinations of railway workers living in places far from the hospitals of the Central District.
AboutUs.description6: The names of the heads of the medical and sanitary service of the company: Briganin, Dmitriyevsky, Sarkisov, I. Umarov, Martirosyan, A. Alimov, A. Akbarov, Sh. Eshonkhajayev, A. M. Miragzamov. Each of them contributed to improving the health of railway workers.
